comments:
I have been having some problems with VE under Windows XP. One one PC if I 
leave a java file open with the VE, close Eclipse, come back later and open 
Eclipse I get the subject error. In addition I cannot close all the error 
messages, thus Eclipse hangs (the only way I have found to close Eclipse is to 
open up Task Manager and terminate the process.

The .log file is included below:
!SESSION 2005-09-21 10:30:52.453 ----------------------------------------------
-
eclipse.buildId=I20050627-1435
java.version=1.5.0_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_CA
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!MESSAGE Skipping builder com.omondo.uml.std.Builder for project Television. 
Either the builder is missing from the install, or it belongs to a project 
nature that is missing or disabled.

Do you have a firewall running? It says the connection was refused. This usually
means there is firewall running and it disallowed the local connection.

Second question. Are you using Java 1.5 for the project's java vm? If you are,
try using 1.4.2 instead. We have a problem with 1.5 being the target vm.
Have you been able to answer my questions yet?

(In reply to comment #2)
> Have you been able to answer my questions yet?

I hae turned off the firewalls, and set the JRE to 1.4.2 (removed 1.5). 
Problem still exists.

(In reply to comment #3)
> (In reply to comment #2)
> > Have you been able to answer my questions yet?
> I hae turned off the firewalls, and set the JRE to 1.4.2 (removed 1.5). 
> Problem still exists.

Additionally I checked the setup on my other PC. It uses JRE 1.5 and is behind 
a firewall. On this computer I can leave a VE file open, close Eclipse, 
restart Eclipse at some later date/time and the file opens just fine in the 
Visual Editor.

If you close a workspace with no VE's open do you ever have a problem opening a
VE later? Or is it only when you start a workspace that had been closed with an
open VE in it?

(In reply to comment #5)
> If you close a workspace with no VE's open do you ever have a problem 
opening a
> VE later? Or is it only when you start a workspace that had been closed with 
an
> open VE in it?

I have the same problem if I either create or open an existing VE file if all 
Eclipse projects are closed when Eclipse is first run.
i'm stumped. There is something strange about your machine or its configuration.

(In reply to comment #7)
> i'm stumped. There is something strange about your machine or its 
configuration.

could it have something to do with SP2 or IPv6?

Maybe IPV6. We've had problems on Linux (SUSE in particular) with IPV6 because
they messed up a control file. Do you have IPV6 turned on? Is that what is
different between your two machines? If you do, how did you turn it on? I've
never tried it.
JEM is, for all practical purposes, out of service.  (The only remaining support for it is provided by the WTP team for WTP.)
